_header: My lady hath me in that grace
Note:
See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1051.
_description: A devoted mistress — two cross-rhymed quatrains and additional refrain, ‘Why shall not I’, and a 4-line introductory burden: ‘Why shall not I / Why shall not I to my lady / Why shall not I be trew / Why shall not I.’

BLAdd31922.First Lines: My lady hath me in that graceshe takes me as her howne…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …alas alas what word ys thisher to remember eft
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notation repeated twice more for three voices.
